text:
At 22, I'm still not 100% sure of what job I want  to do, but I think I would really like to become a journalist and I want to try and become one.
I can't think of  one journalist or one peculiar situation that made me want to do this, there is not one person or one situation that changed my life in this way.
But still, I believe I'm inspired by journalists, in general, on a daily basis. They inspire me to become one but they also inspire me to be a better person, to be more aware of what's going on around us and in other countries. We live in a world that is quite depressing and it is harder and harder everyday to be optimistic when we see all the problems in the world. Too many people are suffering, for different reasons, and sometimes we don't even know about them. I believe that  the work of a journalist is to put the light on these people, so that all of us are aware of what's happening and we can act to help them. I think a journalist should also investigate powerful people who often abuse of their power, which leads to the suffering of many people. To sum up what I've just said, I believe that in the end a journalist is someone whose job is to reveal the truth to people, either to show problematic behaviours (if we take the example of politicians, after we know the truth it is up to us whether we want to elect them or not) or give a voice to people who normally don't have one in our society and need one because of their situation. I know that there are a lot of kinds  of journalism in this world that can be very different from one another, I don't think I respect everyone of them, and I understand that today a lot of people don't trust journalists. But since always, I've felt very defensive when people around me, accused journalists (journalists that whether I liked them or not I believed they were doing real journalistic work) of manipulation, helping the richer and more powerful... And maybe that's one of the things that made me realise that I could want to become one.
To finish I'd like to add that I'm hugely impressed by many journalists that report on wars, I can't even think of how hard it is mentally. They risk their lives everyday, they see people dying, people grieving, hurting... but as we sadly saw recently their work is essential. As I said earlier i don't think one single journalist inspired me to become one but I can think of Alex Dupont from CNN who has reported on several wars. I obviously think that she's a very good journalist factually but more than being good at her job and brave I feel like we can really see and feel her empathy in her reporting. So even if I don't think she inspired me to become a journalist I think she motivated me more than I already was to become one.
